title: Analyze the Forces Acting on the Car
text: The net centripetal force Fc​ is provided by both the horizontal component of the normal force and the frictional force: $$F_c=N sin\left(\theta\right)+f cos\left(\theta\right)$$ where $$F_c=\frac{m v^2}{r}$$ and $$f=μ N$$.

title: Vertical Force Balance
text: As $$N cos\left(\theta\right)=mg+f sin\left(\theta\right)$$, we can write $$N=$$ $$\frac{mg}cos^$\left(\theta\right)-μ sin\left(\theta\righ$$ and substitute it back into the expression for the net force.

title: Solve for the Coefficient of Friction μ
text: Substitute $$F_c=\frac{m v^2}{r}$$ and the expression for N, then solve the equation for μ.
